#Text=Wikinews interview with America 's Got Talent finalists
#Text=At Last
#Text=Saturday , September 2 , 2006
#Text=Singing group
#Text=At Last was recently a finalist in America 's Got Talent , covering songs like " Let 's Stay Together " and " Ai n't No Sunshine " .
#Text=Talent was a NBC television series search for America 's next big talent , featuring singers , dancers , magicians , comedians and other talents of all ages .
#Text=The series was hosted by Regis Philbin , and judged by former tabloid editor Piers Morgan , singer Brandy , and actor/singer David Hasselhoff .
#Text=They talked to Wikinews about their group 's performances and the America 's Got Talent experience .
#Text=Interviews
#Text=Q : At Last performs " hip-hopapella " ( hip hop a cappella ) .
#Text=For those who did n't see you on America 's Got Talent , how would you describe this sound ?
#Text=A : Hip-hopapella was born out of a rehearsal when we were just messing around between songs .

#Text=We were singing " Killing Me Softly " and harmonizing when Mike decided to throw in a beatbox , and it was like WOW ... it was just magical and we knew right away we had discovered a new sound for us .
#Text=Our producer came up with the name .
#Text=Since then it 's really evolved into fat layers of harmonies over a hip hop style bassline and beatbox .
#Text=We like taking old school songs and flipping it hip-hopapella style to create something recognizable yet fresh .
#Text=Q : The band has sung at concerts with many noted names , and on quite a few television series .
#Text=Where in America have audiences been most enthusiastic ?
#Text=A : We think we get the most enthusiastic responses in areas where there are n't a lot of Asian people .
#Text=For example , in the midwest or the south .
#Text=At first , they have their typical stereotypes of what we are .
#Text=All they see is William Hung .
#Text=But then they hear these four Asian guys sing R&B , and they 're shocked .
#Text=After the shock wears off , they realize they just like what they hear , regardless of the faces .
#Text=Q : How did At Last first form ?
#Text=A : We all met at an audition , held by actress Ming-Na , and have been together for five years .
#Text=Together with her , we have the goal of showing America and the world that Asian Americans love music too .
#Text=Q : Of your competitors , who was your personal favorite ?
#Text=( Any point in the competition , not just among the finalists . )
#Text=A : We loved Bobby Badfingers .
#Text=He just had an incredible energy and has flat out the best showman in the competition .
#Text=Backstage , he was so personable too .
#Text=Actually everyone on the show was very friendly and open ... we made a lot of new friends on that show .
#Text=Q : Who was your favourite judge ?
#Text=A : It 's hard not to answer Brandy , because she had so much love for us , especially early on .
#Text=But we have to go with Piers because of his honesty .
#Text=Ultimately , his comments are the ones America respects the most .
#Text=Q : Overall , are you satisfied with the experience " America 's Got Talent " provided ?
#Text=A : We 're very happy with our experience on the show .
#Text=We got more exposure than we ever have before and we 've made some great new friends and contacts .
#Text=We got to show America who we are and what we can do , and even though we did n't win , we 've gained so much .
#Text=Q : What 's next for At Last ?
#Text=A : We finished an album just before we started doing AGT , so we 're going to get back to promoting that and start touring .
